sentences.en: Farthing Lane's just above the High Street and parallel with it.
sentences.cn: 法辛巷刚好在大街的北面，与大街平行。

sentences.en: He does not value that a brass farthing.
sentences.cn: 他把那东西评价得一钱不值.

sentences.en: I am ready to pay to the uttermost farthing.
sentences.cn: 我情愿把这笔债全部还清,连零儿都不剩.

sentences.en: I don't care a brass farthing where you go.
sentences.cn: 你上哪儿去,我才不管呢!

sentences.en: I don't give a brass farthing for what you think, I'm going to do it anyway.
sentences.cn: 至于你怎么想我毫不在乎,不管怎样, 我都打算干.

sentences.en: It matters not a farthing whether she be old or young.
sentences.cn: 她年老还是年轻,那都无关紧要.

sentences.en: Mr John was once in good circumstances, but now he is not worth a farthing.
sentences.cn: 约翰先生的经济情况一度很好, 但是现在却一贫如洗了.

sentences.en: Take a farthing from a thousand pounds, it will be a thousand pound no longer.
sentences.cn: 千镑去一厘, 整整凑不齐.

sentences.en: The ancestor of the modern bicycle is called a penny farthing.
sentences.cn: 现代自行车的原型叫做‘前轮大后轮小的自行车’.

sentences.en: This old clock is not worth a farthing.

words.tran_cn: 一点儿，极少量；法新（1961年以前的英国铜币， 等于1／4便士）

trans.tran_cn: <英>（英国过去的货币，现已不用）四分之一便士，一点儿，极少量
